cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITAjNfNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. September 1943.SECRET.W.M. (43)126th Conclusions.Copy No. 5 0WAR CABINET 126 (43).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W.1, on Wednesday, 8th September, 1943, at 3-15 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P., Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs(in the Chair).The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M:P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Herbert Morrison,M.P., Secretary of State for theHome Department" and Minister ofHome Security.The Right hon. Viscount Halifax,His Majesty's Ambassador to theUnited States of America.The following were also present:The Right Hon. Viscount Cranborne,Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Sir James Grigg,M.P., Secretary of State for War.Sir Orme Sargent, Deputy Under-Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.Vice-Admiral Sir Neville Syfret,Vice-Chief of Naval Staff.The Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Minister of aircraft production.Air Chief Marshal Sir Charles F. APortal, Chief of the Air Staff.Lieutenant-General A. E. Nye, Vice-Chief of the Imperial General Staff.Secretariat.Sir Edward Bridges.Brigadier L, C. Hollis.Italy. The War Cabinet met at short notice to consider the latest(Previous developments in the Italian situation. A record of the discussionReference: is contained in the Secretary's Standard File of War cabinet.M.(43)- 125th Conclusions.Conclusions.) ..Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W. 1,8th September, 1943.[26060^-2]
